== Main Inclusion Report for pxljr ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/p/pxljr, available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** This driver gives high quality support for HPÂ´s Color LaserJet 35xx/36xx series (HP JetReady protocol). HP's driver HPIJS only supports the lowest quality (highest compression) mode, this driver supports all modes which are also available under Windows.
 0. ''Security:''
** No <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=pxljr|CVE entries]]</nowiki>.
** No <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=pxljr|Secunia history]]</nowiki>.
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid.
** Does not open any port.
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Package works out of the box, requiring no configuration different to other printer drivers. Simply plug the printer, start the printer setup tool of your choice and choose the "pxljr" driver (should be default, as this one is the recommended driver for the supported printers).
** Package does not ask any debconf questions.
** Active <nowiki>[[http://sourceforge.net/projects/hp-pxl-jetready/|upstream]]</nowiki>. Additional user support via Openprinting (http://www.openprinting.org/, http://forums.freestandards.org/list.php?20).
** No critical bugs in <nowiki>[[http://sourceforge.net/tracker/?group_id=123386&atid=696345|upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** Meets the <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki>, PPD files meet Adobe standard (test by running them through "cupstestppd" passes).
** Standard debhelper/cdbs/dbs packaging, standard patch system.
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** All in main.
